intro: Sisymbrium alpestre, commonly known as the alpine mustard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, dry conditions. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by pods that release tiny seeds. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh mountain climates and it is often found in open, sunny habitats.
